'''Peter David Schiff''' ({{IPA-en|ËÊÉªf|pron}}; born March 23, 1963) is an American [[investment broker]], [[author]] and financial [[Pundit (expert)|commentator]]. Schiff is [[CEO]] and chief global strategist<ref name=official/> of Euro Pacific Capital Inc., a [[broker-dealer]] based in [[Westport, Connecticut|Westport]], [[Connecticut]]<ref name=epcabout>{{Cite web | title = About Euro Pacific Capital | publisher = [[Euro Pacific Capital]] | url = http://www.europac.net/about/company_profile | format = | doi = | accessdate = 2011-01-15}}</ref> and CEO of Euro Pacific Precious Metals, LLC, a gold and silver dealer based in [[New York City]].<ref name=epmetals>{{Cite web | title = Our Company | publisher = Euro Pacific Precious Metals | url = http://www.europacmetals.com/our-company.aspx | accessdate = 2011-01-08}}</ref>
Schiff frequently appears as a guest on CNBC, Fox Business Channel, and Bloomberg Television and is often quoted in major financial publications<ref> {{Cite web |url=http://www.europac.net/video.asp |title=Euro Pacific Capital | Video Archives |publisher=www.europac.net |accessdate=2009-03-04 |last= |first= }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} </ref> and is a frequent guest on [[internet radio]]<ref name=radio> {{Cite web |url=http://www.europac.net/radioshow.asp |title=Euro Pacific Capital | Weekly Radio Broadcast |publisher=www.europac.net |accessdate=2009-03-04 |last= |first= }} </ref><ref> {{Cite web |url=http://www.financialsense.com/Experts/2007/Schiff.html |title=Financial Sense Newshour's Ask The Expert: Peter D. Schiff 03.10.2007 |publisher=www.financialsense.com |accessdate=2009-03-04 |last= |first= }} </ref><ref> {{Cite web |url=http://www.financialsense.com/fsu/editorials/schiff/archive.html |title=Peter Schiff - FSU Editorial Archives |publisher=www.financialsense.com |accessdate=2009-03-04 |last= |first= }} </ref> as well as the host of the former [[podcast]] ''Wall Street Unspun'',<ref>[http://www.podfeed.net/podcast/Wall+Street+Unspun+with+Peter+Schiff/15592 Podfeed.net: Wall Street Unspun with Peter Schiff]</ref> which is now broadcast on [[terrestrial radio]] and known as ''The Peter Schiff Show''.<ref name=radio/> In 2010 Schiff ran as a candidate in the Republican primary for the [[United States Senate]] seat from Connecticut.<ref name=announce/>
Schiff is known for his [[Market trend#Bear market|bearish]] views on the dollar and dollar denominated assets, while [[Market trend#Bull market|bullish]] on investment in tangible assets as well as foreign stocks and currencies.
==Early life and education== The son of [[Irwin Schiff]], a prominent figure in the [[Tax protester (United States)|United States tax protester movement]], Peter Schiff was born and raised in [[New Haven, Connecticut|New Haven]], Connecticut.<ref name="PSBUS">{{Cite press release |url=http://schiffforsenate.com/?q=news/peter-schiff-announces-bid-us-senate |title=Peter Schiff Announces Bid for US Senate |date=September 17, 2009 |publisher=Peter Schiff for Senate 2010 |accessdate=2009-11-17}}</ref> Schiff attended [[Beverly Hills High School]] in California.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x_QO4WRmmE0 |title=After The Bell: U.S. Back in Focus |publisher=Fox Business |date=2011-10-28 |accessdate=2011-10-31}}</ref> Subsequently, Schiff graduated from the [[University of California, Berkeley]] in 1987 with a [[Bachelor of Business Administration|Bachelor]]'s degree in [[finance]] and [[accounting]].</small><ref name=official/>
==Financial career== Schiff began his career as a financial consultant at a [[Shearson Lehman Brothers]] brokerage.<ref name=official>[http://www.europac.net/members/peter_schiff ], [http://www.europac.net/ Inc.] Retrieved 2010-11-03.</ref> In 1996 Schiff and a partner acquired a small [[broker dealer|brokerage]] firm that had been founded in 1980, [[Incorporation (business)|reincorporated]] it in [[California]] and renamed it Euro Pacific Capital.<ref name=sfsbio/><ref name=okeefecnn>{{Cite news| last = O'Keefe | first = Brian | title = : Oh, he saw it coming | newspaper = [[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] | date = January 23, 2009 | url = http://money.cnn.com/2009/01/20/magazines/fortune/okeefe_schiff.fortune/index.htm | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5oz96pIPX | archivedate = 2010-04-14 | accessdate = 2010-04-14 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref> The company today has more than 15,000 clients{{Citation needed|date=September 2010}} and six offices nationwide, with its headquarters in Westport, Connecticut.<ref name=epcabout/><ref name=sfsbio>{{Cite web| url = http://schiffforsenate.com/?q=about| title = About Peter| year = 2009| publisher = Schiff For Senate}}</ref><ref name=tacbio>{{Cite news | last = Dougherty | first = Michael Brendan | title = Dr. Doom Runs for Senate | newspaper = [[The American Conservative]] | pages = | date = 2009-10-01 | url = http://www.amconmag.com/article/2009/oct/01/00010/ | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5vlkGp27S | archivedate = 2011-01-15 | accessdate = 2011-01-15 | postscript = <!-- Bot inserted parameter. Either remove it; or change its value to "." for the cite to end in a ".", as necessary. -->{{inconsistent citations}}}}</ref>
According to a 2005 article in ''[[The Advocate (Stamford)|The Advocate]]'' of [[Stamford, Connecticut]] Schiff relocated the firm to [[Darien, Connecticut]] to find brokers "who think like him". The New York Metropolitan Area, Schiff says, has the biggest concentration of brokers in the country, making it easier to recruit employees.<ref name=lapin>"Prophet of Doom? Darien market bear says U.S. investors' ship is sinking," article by Julie Fishman-Lapin in ''The Advocate'' of Stamford, Business section, August 6, 2006, pp. F1, F6</ref> The company has offices in [[Newport Beach, California]] as well as in [[Scottsdale, Arizona]], [[Palm Beach, Florida]], [[Los Angeles]] and New York City. Euro Pacific Capital also holds the exclusive rights to broker some [[Perth Mint]] gold products in the United States.<ref>Crash Proof 2.0, pg. 300</ref>
In 2011 Peter Schiff was listed as one of the Who's Who of Wall Street. <ref>Wall Street Economists, [http://www.wallstreeteconomists.org/ Wall Street Economists]</ref>
In the years of 2006-2008 Schiff appeared on numerous TV new's networks including CNBC & Fox. As he sat on panel's of experts, he was usually laughed at by other's, as he was more pessimistic about financial markets going into the future than others, Saying that in 2007 that "Today's home prices are completely unsustainable. Sky high real-estate prices are going to come crashing back down to earth." Most experts were high on financial stocks & recommended stocks such as Merrill-Lynch & Goldman Sachs. They were also saying that "the worst was over", while Schiff was saying that the fundamentals (of U.S financial markets) were bad & the worst was yet to come. Schiff warned to "stay away from the financials, they're toxic & their earnings are going to disappear." [[Arthur Laffer]] said to Schiff that he would "Bet [him] a penny on this one (on being wrong about a real-estate bubble burst), If you'll sign a letter saying that you were wrong to me on this."
==Economic forecasting== Peter Schiff specializes in the understanding of the [[Austrian School]],<ref name="CrashProof2.0p21">Crash Proof 2.0, pg. 21</ref> a [[Schools of economic thought|school of economic thought]] generally categorized as [[heterodox economics|heterodox]] (or non-mainstream).<ref name="CrashProof2.0p21"/><ref name="Boettke and Leeson">{{Cite book|last=Boettke|first=Peter J.|coauthors=Peter T. Leeson|title=A Companion to the History of Economic Thought|editor=Warren Samuels, Jeff E. Biddle, and John B. Davis|pages=446â452 |chapter=28: Postwar Heterodox Economics |url= http://books.google.com/?id=3H8gBQv5MysC&pg=PA445&dq=austrian+school+heterodox+economics |publisher=Blackwell Publishing |year=2003 |isbn=978-0-631-22573-7}}</ref><ref name="ifn">{{Cite journal |last=Douhan |first=Robin |last2=Henrekson |first2=Magnus |last3=Eliasson|first3=Gunnar|title=Israel M. Kirzner: An Outstanding Austrian Contributor to the Economics of Entrepreneurship |journal=Small Business Economics|volume=29|issue= 1â2 |year=2007 |ssrn= 996882 |publisher=Kluwer Academic Publishers}}</ref> Schiff voices strong support for the Austrian School, and says it was first introduced to him by his father, [[Irwin Schiff]].<ref name=swanson>{{Cite web| last = Swanson | first = Tim | title = Interview with Peter Schiff| publisher = [[Ludwig von Mises Institute]] | date = April 21, 2008 | url = http://blog.mises.org/8039/interview-with-peter-schiff/ | accessdate = 2010-04-11}}</ref>
===U.S. bear market=== In his 2007 book ''[[Crash Proof]]'', Schiff wrote that United States economic policies were fundamentally unsound, and predicted that the United States dollar would lose much of its value.<ref name=crashproof/> Schiff believed that the imbalance between the amount of goods the U.S. consumed and what it produced would eventually lead to problems for the [[United States economy|U.S. economy]].<ref>Crash Proof 2.0 Chapter 1: Consumers, Not Producers (pps. 1-32)</ref><ref>{{Cite video | people = Peter Schiff | title = Why the Meltdown Should Have Surprised No One | url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EgMclXX5msc&feature=PlayList&p=233FD972BBC2927B&index=0 | medium = Recorded live lecture | publisher = [[Ludwig von Mises Institute]] | location = [[Auburn, Alabama]] | date = 2009-03-13}}</ref> As a remedy Schiff favored increased personal savings and production which he said would stimulate economic growth.<ref>Crash Proof 2.0, pg. 7</ref> Schiff cited the U.S.'s low personal savings rate as one of the causes of its transformation from the world's largest creditor nation in the 1970s to the largest debtor nation in the year 2000.<ref>Crash Proof 2.0, pg. 76</ref> Schiff attributed the low savings rate to higher inflation and the artificially low interest rates set by the [[Federal Reserve]].<ref>Crash Proof 2.0, pg. 39</ref>
In a 2002 interview with ''Southland Today'', Schiff predicted that the economic downturn triggered by the bursting of the [[Dot-com bubble|dot-com stock market bubble]] would lead to a bear market likely to last "another 5 to 10 years."<ref name=critics>{{cite video |people = Peter Schiff |date = September 7, 2009 |title = Debunking another critic |url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SSAtsvSaX5I |format = Flash |publisher = Schiff Report |medium = [[Video Blog]] |location = [[Stamford, Connecticut|Stamford]] |archiveurl =|archivedate= |accessdate = 2010-05-03}}</ref><ref name="emperor" /> In November 2002, US stock indexes began a bull market uptrend which held steady for five years,<ref> {{Cite news |last=Krantz |first=Matt |title= Bull rides into fifth anniversary |date=October 10, 2007 |work=[[Wall Street Journal]] |url=http://www.usatoday.com/money/markets/2007-10-08-bull-market_N.htm }} </ref> until reversing course in 2008, when they began a decline to less than half of their peak 2008 values,<ref>{{Cite news| last = Roth | first = Allan | title = Why It Wasnât a âLost Decadeâ for Investors | newspaper = [[CBS MoneyWatch.com]] | date = December 18, 2009 | url = http://moneywatch.bnet.com/economic-news/article/why-it-wasnt-a-lost-decade-for-investors/375568/ | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5pSx3xVEg | archivedate = 2010-05-03 | accessdate = 2010-05-03 }}</ref> followed in 2009 by the Dow climbing 61% from its low point over the following year.<ref> {{Cite news |last=Paradis |first=Tim |title= The Rebound: Numbers tell story of market recovery |date=March 7, 2010 |work=[[BusinessWeek]] |url=http://www.businessweek.com/ap/financialnews/D9EA0U480.htm }} </ref> After interviewing Schiff in 2009, journalist and finance author Eric Tyson referenced various Schiff predictions during the 2000s and stated that "On all of these counts, Schiff wasn't just wrong but ended up being hugely wrong."<ref name=tyson>Tyson, Eric. [http://www.erictyson.com/articles/20090213 "I Don't Think I've Been Wrong on Anything"]</ref>
In an August 2006 interview he said: "The United States economy is like the [[RMS Titanic|Titanic]] and I am here with the lifeboat trying to get people to leave the ship... I see a real financial crisis coming for the United States."<ref name="Kitco">{{Cite web |url= http://www.kitco.com/ind/Radomski/feb022010.html |title= Silver Is Poised to Rise in The Long Run, But The Short-term Situation Is Complicated |author= Przemyslaw Radomski |date= February 2, 2010 |publisher= Kitco |accessdate=2010-05-04}}</ref> On December 31, 2006 in debate on Fox News, Schiff forecast that "what's going to happen in 2007" is that "real estate prices are going to come crashing back down to Earth".<ref name="Kitco"/>
As part of these exchanges on Fox News and his repeated appearances on financial news network CNBC, Schiff had mentioned factors such as speculators and "the absence of lending standards" which are now seen by many<ref>{{Cite web|last=Wallison |first=Peter J. |url=http://www.aei.org/publications/filter.all,pubID.29047/pub_detail.asp |title=''What Got Us Here?'', December 2008 |publisher=Aei.org |date=2008-12-09 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|author=This American Life |url=http://www.pri.org/business/giant-pool-of-money.html |title=NPR-The Giant Pool of Money |publisher=Pri.org |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> to indeed be contributing factors to the [[United States housing bubble#Subprime mortgage industry collapse|housing crisis]] which began in 2007. On December 13, 2007 in a Bloomberg interview on the show ''Open Exchange'', Schiff further added that he felt that the crisis would extend to the credit card lending industry.<ref>[http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-5786330387747098530 Peter Schiff's accurate forecast of credit card market trouble]</ref> Following this observation, it was soon reported on December 23, 2007 by the Associated Press that "The value of credit card accounts at least 30 days late jumped 26 percent to $17.3 billion in October from a year earlier at 17 large credit card trusts examined by the AP... At the same time, defaults -- when lenders essentially give up hope of ever being repaid and write off the debt -- rose 18 percent to almost $961 million in October, according to filings made by the trusts with the Securities and Exchange Commission."<ref>[http://money.cnn.com/2007/12/23/news/economy/credit_card_crunch.ap/ December 2007 Associate Press Story on Credit Card Defaults validates Schiff's gloomy predictions]</ref>
Since 2007, Schiff has stated many times that if the government doesn't change course there will be hyperinflation in the US.<ref name=crashproof>{{Cite document | last = Schiff | first = Peter D. | last2 = Downes | first2 = John | title = Crash Proof: How to Profit from the Coming Economic Collapse | publisher = [[John Wiley & Sons]] | date = February 2007 | location = [[New Jersey]] | pages = | url = | doi = | isbn = 978-0-470-04360-8 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref> Schiff is one of a minority of economists credited with accurately predicting the [[financial crisis of 2007â2010]] while "nearly all [macroeconomists] failed to foresee the recession despite plenty of warning signs".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://mpra.ub.uni-muenchen.de/15892/|title="No One Saw This Coming": Understanding Financial Crisis Through Accounting Models|last=Bezemer |first=Dirk J |date = June 2009|publisher=Munich Personal RePEc Archive |accessdate=2010-04-22}}</ref><ref name=goodeconomists>{{Cite news| last = Coy | first = Peter| title = What Good Are Economists Anyway? | newspaper = [[Business Week]] | date = April 16, 2009 | url = http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/09_17/b4128026997269.htm?chan=top+news_economics+subindex+page_economics | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5pBC0dWFa | archivedate = 2010-04-22 | accessdate = 2010-04-22 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref> In his book ''Crash Proof'', he described several aspects of the U.S. economy that would lead to a recession.<ref name=crashproof/>
===Online videos=== [[Image:Peter Schiff Portrait Video Blog.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Peter Schiff became known for his video blogs discussing the U.S. economy]] A [[You Tube]] video entitled "Peter Schiff was right" became popular in late 2008 and 2009.<ref name=yahoopredict>{{Cite news| last = Task | first = Aaron | title = 'Crisis Only Just Beginning': Right About the Crash, Peter Schiff Sees More Pain Ahead | newspaper = [[Yahoo! Finance]] | date = November 24, 2008 | url = http://finance.yahoo.com/tech-ticker/article/134633/%27Crisis-Only-Just-Beginning%27-Right-About-the-Crash-Peter-Schiff-Sees-More-Pain-Ahead?tickers=^dji,^gspc,^ixic,SPY,DIA,QQQQ,GLD | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5oz7OHfZ0 | archivedate = 2010-04-14 | accessdate = 2010-04-14 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref><ref name=newyorkmag>{{Cite news| last = Pressler | first = Jessica | title = Financial Pundit Peter Schiff Launches Senate Run | newspaper = [[New York Magazine]] | date = September 17, 2009 | url = http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2009/09/doomsdaying_economist_peter_sc.html | archiveurl = | archivedate = | accessdate = 2010-04-16 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref> The video consists of a compilation of clips of his many appearances on various financial news programs from networks including [[CNBC]], [[Fox News]], [[MSNBC]] and [[Bloomberg Television|Bloomberg]], most of which took place from 2005 to 2007. In the video segments Schiff explains the fundamental problems he saw with the United States economy at that time. Schiff's warnings of a coming [[economic collapse]] earned him the [[moniker]] "Dr. Doom."<ref name=okeefecnn/><ref name=schiffwasright2>{{cite video |people = Peter Schiff |date = February 20, 2009 |title = Peter Schiff was right 2006-2007 - CNBC edition |url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z0YTY5TWtmU |format = Flash |medium = Television production (clip compilation) |accessdate = 2010-04-14}}</ref><ref name=schiffwasright1>{{cite video |people = Peter Schiff |date = November 2, 2008 |title = Peter Schiff Was Right 2006 - 2007 (2nd Edition) |url = http://peterschiffchannel.blogspot.com/2011/02/peter-schiff-was-right-2006-2007-cnbc.html |format = Flash |medium = Television production (clip compilation) |accessdate = 2010-04-14}}</ref>
===Investment advice=== Despite predictions regarding the housing bubble and automotive industry difficulties coming to fruition, as early as 2009 Schiff was receiving criticism due to the performance of some of his client's accounts in 2008, as well as controversies over the predictions themselves. In January 2009, economic [[blog]]ger and investment adviser Michael Shedlock reported, "I have talked with many who claim they have invested with Schiff and are down anywhere from 40% to 70% in 2008."<ref name=shedlock>{{Cite web | last = Shedlock | first = Michael | title = Peter Schiff Was Wrong | date = January 25, 2009 | url = http://globaleconomicanalysis.blogspot.com/2009/01/peter-schiff-was-wrong.html | accessdate = 2010-05-21 | postscript = <!--None-->}} </ref> Other criticisms followed, including the aforementioned Eric Tyson post<ref name=tyson/> as well as an article for the investment news site [[Seeking Alpha]], published on the site two days after Shedlock's blog post.<ref name=alphacritic/> Later that week an article appeared in the ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'' reporting that Schiff's broker-dealer firm, Euro Pacific Capital Inc., "advised its clients to bet that the dollar would weaken significantly and that foreign stocks would outpace their U.S. peers" and that instead, the dollar advanced against most currencies, "magnifying the losses from foreign stocks Mr. Schiff steered his investors into."<ref name="Schiff_wrong_plan"> {{Cite news |last=Patterson |first=Scott |last2=Slater |first2=Joanna |last3=Karmin |first3=Craig |title= Right Forecast by Schiff, Wrong Plan? |date=January 30, 2009 |work=[[Wall Street Journal]] |url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB123327685671031439.html}} </ref>
The Director of Communications at Schiff's investment firm responded to the original Shedlock piece by saying, "While it is true, that our accounts have suffered badly in 2008, a fact that we have never disputed or ran from, [Shedlock's] estimates for the size of our typical client losses are exaggerated and unfair."<ref name=alphacritic>{{Cite news | last = Dwinnell | first = Tate | title = Peter Schiff's Euro Pacific Capital: Down 40-70% in 2008? | newspaper = [[Seeking Alpha]] | date = January 27, 2009 | url = http://seekingalpha.com/article/116694-peter-schiff-s-euro-pacific-capital-down-40-70-in-2008 | archiveurl = | archivedate = | accessdate = 2010-05-21 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://weblogs.baltimoresun.com/business/hancock/blog/2009/01/schiff_firm_shedlock_exaggerat.html |title=Jay Hancock's blog: Schiff firm: Shedlock exaggerates our clients' losses - Business news: Stock markets, banks and economic observations with columnist Jay Hancock - baltimoresun.com |publisher=Weblogs.baltimoresun.com |date=2009-01-26 |accessdate=2010-08-15}}</ref> Schiff personally responded to Shedlock's criticism by saying, "to examine the effectiveness of my investment strategy immediately following a major correction by looking only at those accounts who adopted the strategy at the previous peak is unfair and distortive" and called Shedlock's blog entry "nothing more than an overt advertisement (and a highly deceptive one at that) to use my popularity to advance his career," adding that losses were felt mostly by recent clients and not by others.<ref>Shinkle, Kirk. [http://www.usnews.com/blogs/the-ticker/2009/01/30/peter-schiff-responds.html Peter Schiff Responds], ''U.S. News'', January 30, 2009. Retrieved September 5, 2009.</ref>
Schiff responded similarly to criticisms made by Wade Slome of Sidoxia Capital Management, LLC. in a September 2009 blog entry entitled, "The Emperor Schiff Has No Clothes."<ref name="emperor"> {{Cite web |url=http://investingcaffeine.com/2009/09/07/the-emperor-schiff-has-no-clothes/ |title=The Emperor Schiff Has No Clothes |accessdate=2010-05-03 |last=Slome |first=Wade}} </ref> Schiff stated not only were the losses suffered by his clients in 2008 highly exaggerated, but also that most of those losses have already been recouped, stating that many who where down then are now up, and most long-term clients were never down at all, but merely temporarily lost some of the profits they had earned over the years.<ref name="emperor"/>
The January 2009 ''Wall Street Journal'' article discussed the value of Schiff's predictions, and stated how deficiencies "made mincemeat of investors who took his advice in 2008."<ref name="Schiff_wrong_plan"/> In an interview the following week Schiff likened himself to billionaire investor [[Warren Buffett]], saying they were both "buy and hold" long-term investors. Contrasting his negative press he compared claims about accounts managed under Schiff's firm to the stock market value of Buffett's company, saying: "His approach is you buy stocks and you never sell themâyou hope to never sell themâand [[Berkshire Hathaway]] is down 40% in the last thirteen months; I don't see the Wall Street Journal saying 'Warren Buffett made mincemeat out of his clients.'"<ref name="Schiff_right"> {{Cite news | last = Task | first = Aaron | title = Peter Schiff: Why I'm Right and My Critics Are All Wrong | newspaper = [[Yahoo! Finance]] Tech Ticker | date = February 6, 2009 | url = http://finance.yahoo.com/tech-ticker/article/169961/Peter-Schiff-Why-I%27m-Right-and-My-Critics-Are-All-Wrong?tickers=^dji,^gspc,QQQQ,SPY,DIA,SHV,UDN | archiveurl = | archivedate = | accessdate = 2010-05-21 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref> The ''Wall Street Journal'' also published a letter written by Schiff in response to his critics saying: "My central investing premise, a weakening dollar and safety in gold, commodities and foreign stocks, didn't materialize in 2008. But all the ingredients were (and remain) present for those movements to occur. Over the past year, market reactions that I didn't foresee—massive global deleveraging, a knee-jerk 'flight to quality' into U.S. Treasuries and a sharp counter trend rally in the U.S. dollar—have kept the scenario from playing out."<ref>{{Cite news | last = Schiff | first = Peter | author-link = | title = Our Investing Plan Is Right, if Slightly Ahead of the Times | newspaper = [[Wall Street Journal]] | date = February 10, 2009 | url = http://online.wsj.com/article/SB123423701044366741.html | archiveurl = | archivedate = | accessdate = | postscript = <!--None--> }}</ref>
In a November 2009 videoblog, Schiff said that five stocks he picked for ''Fortune Magazine'' in January 2009 had gained a total of 360%.<ref>{{Cite news| url=http://money.cnn.com/2009/01/20/magazines/fortune/okeefe_schiff_sidebar.fortune/index.htm | work=CNN | title=A 'fire sale' on small foreign stocks | date=2009-01-20 | accessdate=2010-05-22 | first=Brian | last=O'Keefe}}</ref><ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQUSjOw2cYE YouTube - JOBS & GOLD<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
In a March 2009 speech Schiff said that it would be impossible for the [[United States public debt|U.S. debt]] to China to be repaid unless the U.S. dollar's value is substantially diluted through [[inflation]]. In September 2009 Schiff said that "I would not be surprised to see [gold] at $5,000 over the next several years" and that the 2009 stock market rally was a "bear market rally".<ref>http://www.businessinsider.com/henry-blodget-peter-schiff-us-stock-rally-and-dollar-doomed-gold-going-to-5000-2009</ref>
==Political career== Schiff was an economic adviser to [[Ron Paul]]'s [[Ron Paul presidential campaign, 2008|2008 presidential campaign]]. In support of Paul's economic revitalization plan, he said: "We need a plan that stimulates savings and production, not more of the reckless borrowing and consumption that got us into this mess in the first place. Ron Paul's plan is the only one that amounts to a step in the right direction. If you want meaningful change—for the better that is—Ron Paul is the only candidate capable of delivering it."<ref>{{Cite news|title=Peter Schiff Named Economic Advisor to the Ron Paul 2008 Presidential Campaign |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS255917+25-Jan-2008+BW20080125 |work=Reuters.com Online News |publisher=Reuters |date=2008-01-25 |accessdate=2008-10-08 }}</ref>
In 2008, Schiff also endorsed [[Murray Sabrin]] for the U.S. Senate seat in New Jersey.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Paul stumps for Sabrin in Newark |url=http://www.politickernj.com/matt-friedman/19118/paul-stumps-sabrin-newark |work=PolitickerNJ.com |date=2008-04-28 |accessdate=2008-10-17}}</ref>
In an interview in February 2009, Schiff's position was summarized as a nonpartisan critique of American policymakers, comparing former presidents [[George W. Bush]] to [[Herbert Hoover]] and President [[Barack Obama]] to former president [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]], with neither of the more recent incumbents comparing favorably to the earlier ones.<ref>[http://finance.yahoo.com/tech-ticker/article/169781/Peter-Schiff-Stimulus-Bill-Will-Lead-to-%22Unmitigated-Disaster%22?tickers=^dji,^gspc,QQQQ,SPY,DIA,TLT,UDN "Peter Schiff: Stimulus Bill Will Lead to 'Unmitigated Disaster'"], by Aaron Task, ''Yahoo Tech Ticker'', Feb. 06, 2009 08:05am EST. Retrieved 2010-05-23.</ref>
Schiff supports the reduction of government economic regulation, and is concerned that President Obama's administration may increase such regulation.<ref>[http://www.europac.net/externalframeset.asp?from=home&id=14566] November 2008 The Reagan Counterrevolution</ref> Schiff says that the [[Late-2000s financial crisis|economic crisis of the late-2000s]] provides an opportunity to transition from borrowing and spending, to saving and producing. He is critical of the U.S. government's efforts to "ease the pain" with economic stimulus packages and bailouts. According to Schiff, the U.S. government's approach of replacing "legitimate savings with a printing press" could result in [[hyperinflation]].<ref>{{Cite episode | title = Nov. 05, 2008 | episodelink = | url = http://www.europac.net/media/PeterSchiff_11-05-2008.mp3 | series = Wall Street Unspun | serieslink = | url = http://www.europac.net/radioshow_archives.asp?year=2008&qtr=4 | airdate = 2008-11-05}}</ref>
===2010 U.S. Senate campaign=== {{Main|United States Senate election in Connecticut, 2010}}
In December 2008, Connecticut citizens created a website encouraging Schiff to campaign against the incumbent Senator [[Christopher Dodd]].<ref name="Interview1">{{Cite news|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/10/01/AR2009100103890.html|title=Hard-Core Free-Marketeer A Conversation With Peter Schiff: Investor, Critic, Candidate|last=Ahran|first=Frank|date=Sunday, October 4, 2009 |work=Outlook & Opinions |accessdate=2009-10-03}}</ref><ref>[http://www.schiff2010.com/ Peter Schiff for Connecticut Senator 2010]</ref> Approximately 5,000 people made campaign contributions using the web site.<ref name="Interview1"/> On February 21, 2009, a [[moneybomb]] raised over $20,000 for Schiff's campaign.<ref>[http://www.dailypaul.com/node/83752 ''Peter Schiff Money Bomb a Success!'']</ref> In a May 2009 video blog, Schiff said that he was seriously considering a run for the senate and when questioned by a ''[[Washington Post]]'' reporter, he said the chance of him entering politics was "better than 50-50".<ref>{{Cite news|title=Analyst Who Predicted Meltdown Leaning Towards Challenging Chris Dodd|url=http://theplumline.whorunsgov.com/economy/analyst-who-predicted-meltdown-leaning-towards-challening-chris-dodd/ |work=theplumline.whorunsgov.com |date=2009-05-26 |accessdate=2009-05-29 }}</ref> In June 2009 Schiff commissioned a poll of likely voters which indicated that he trailed Dodd in popularity by four percentage points.<ref>{{cite press release |publisher= Wilson Research Strategies |url=http://www.w-r-s.com/blog/2009/07/01/survey-peter-schiff-can-be-competitive-with-chris-dodd-rob-simmons |title=Survey: Peter Schiff Competitive With Chris Dodd, Rob Simmons |date=July 1, 2009 |accessdate=2009-11-17}}</ref> On July 9, 2009, Schiff launched an [[exploratory committee]] and an official campaign website.<ref name="Interview1"/> He began accepting donations in an attempt to see if "people who really believe in freedom, liberty, sound money and the constitution are prepared to support that with an actual political contribution or to volunteer their services and work on this campaign." He received over 10,000 donations and many e-mails from around the world.<ref name="Interview1" />
After giving some hints on ''[[The Daily Show]]''<ref>{{Cite news| last = Cadei | first = Emily | title = Schiff Discusses Potential Dodd Challenge on Daily Show | newspaper = [[Congressional Quarterly]] | date = 2009-06-10 | url = http://blogs.cqpolitics.com/eyeon2010/2009/06/investor-and-financial-comment.html | accessdate = 2010-02-05 | postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref> Schiff officially announced his candidacy for the Republican nomination on September 17, 2009, during the [[MSNBC]] ''[[Morning Joe]]'' show.<ref name=announce>{{Cite news| last = Eddlem | first = Thomas R. | title = Peter Schiff Announces Conn. Senate Candidacy | newspaper = [[The New American]] | date = September 17, 2009 | url = http://www.thenewamerican.com/index.php/usnews/politics/1908-peter-schiff-announces-conn-senate-candidacy | archiveurl = | archivedate = | accessdate = 2010-04-10 | postscript = <!--None-->}} </ref><ref>{{cite video |people = Peter Schiff, [[Joe Scarborough]] (host) |date = 2009-09-17 |title = Peter Schiff formally announces his candidacy for U.S. Senate |url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=usVyfMyitHc |format = Flash |medium = Television production |publisher = [[MSNBC]] |location = [[New York City]] |archiveurl = |archivedate= |accessdate = 2010-04-11}}</ref><ref>{{Cite video|people=Peter Schiff|date=2009-09-17 |title=It's official, I'm in. |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lm4Ya-LRuu0|format=Flash|medium=Video blog|publisher=SchiffReport|accessdate=2009-09-20}}</ref> By October 2009 Schiff had received more than 10,000 telephone calls and letters<ref name="Interview1" /> and raised over $1,960,000 (USD) in campaign contributions.
At the May 2010 Republican convention, [[Linda McMahon]] received the most delegate votes but not enough to prevent an August [[primary election]]. U.S. Rep. [[Rob Simmons]] received more than the required 15 percent of the total votes necessary to force the primary. Schiff then collected the signatures necessary to earn a position on the August 2010 GOP primary ballot, submitting at least 400 signatures over the state requirement.
In July 2010, Schiff's campaign received endorsements from [[Steve Forbes]] and [[Ron Paul]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=Dawn |first=Liberty |url=http://blogs.courant.com/capitol_watch/2010/07/peter-schiff-snags-a-bigname-e.html |title=Peter Schiff snags a big-name endorsement - Capitol Watch |publisher=Blogs.courant.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|author=Ron Paul|title=Ron Paul Endorses Peter Schiff and Rick Torres |date=2010-07-29}}</ref>
In the Republican primary, held on August 10, 2010, Schiff lost the nomination to [[Linda McMahon]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ctpost.com/news/article/McMahon-sweeps-to-victory-in-GOP-Senate-race-610694.php|title=McMahon sweeps to victory in GOP Senate race|author=Neil Vigdor and Brian Lockhart|publisher=[[Connecticut Post]]|date=August 11, 2010|accessdate=August 11, 2010}}</ref>
The results were:<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailypaul.com/node/142075|title=Peter Schiff for US Senate Primary Electrion Results|author=cbourne|publisher=Daily Paul|date=August 10, 2010|accessdate=August 11, 2010}}</ref> * 49% Linda McMahon * 28% Rob Simmons * 23% Peter Schiff
Ultimately, the election was won by the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] primary winner, [[Richard Blumenthal]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/video/2010/11/02/VI2010110208394.html | work=The Washington Post | title=Democrat Blumenthal wins Conn. Senate seat | date=2010-11-03}}</ref>
